Event: Allied forces begin strikes on military targets
US Forces gain control of Baghdad
President Bush gives "Mission Accomplished" speech from the aircraft carrier Abraham Lincoln
UN compound in Baghdad bombed, killing 17 and wounding 100
Saddam Hussein captured near Tikrit
Reports surface of prisoner abuse at the Abu Ghraib prison
American authorities transfer formal sovereignty back to Iraq
Second battle of Falluja begins
Iraq's first free elections in 50 years held
Saddam Hussein's trial begins in Baghdad
Parlimentary elections held
The golden dome at the Askariya Shrine in Samarra is bombed, setting off sectarian violence
Shia leaders select Nuri Kamal al-Maliki as their nominee for prime minister
US forces kill Abu Musab al-Zarqawi, the leader of Al Qaeda in Iraq
US Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld resigns
Saddam Hussein is hanged in Baghdad
President Bush announces "the surge", the deployment of 30,000 additional troops to Iraq and the switch to counterinsurgency tactics
US begins to arm Sunni Arab groups that promise to fight Al Qaeda in Iraq
Shia cleric Moktada al-Sadr announces a six month suspension of his militia's operations
Blackwater guards escorting a diplomatic convoy kill 17 civilians in Nisour Square in Baghdad
American commanders transfer responsibility for Anbar province back to the Iraqi Army and police
The Iraqi Parliament ratifies a status of forces agreement with the US, calling for the departure of troops from Iraqi cities by summer of 2009 and the entire country by the end of 2011
The new US Embassy compound in Baghdad is dedicated
US troops withdraw from Iraqi cities
Iraq holds parlimentary elections
President Obama declares an end to the US's combat mission
Defense Secretary Leon Panetta supports a plan to keep 3000-4000 US troops in Iraq after the deadline for withdrawal, to continue training security forces
The US declares a formal end to operations in Iraq at a ceremony in Baghdad
The last US troops leave Iraq, leaving less than 150 personnel for security cooperation
ISIS captures large swathes of territory in Syria, giving them a base of operations
ISIS captures Falluja
ISIS captures Mosul
ISIS captures Tikrit, Saddam Hussein's hometown
Iran sends Revolutionary Guard forces to Iraq
Iraqi prime minister Nouri al-Maliki steps down amidst international pressure and allegations of sectarian policies
Iraq recaptures Tikrit from ISIS
